option.name: descriptionText
option.value:
Prerequisite:
Read the hashing notebook.

Task:
Complete the function answer. Given an array of integers arr your function has to check if there exist four elements in the array such that they add up to a specific value k. Return a 4-tuple such that its elements add up to k if there exists such a 4-tuple and None otherwise. If there are more than one 4-tuple satisfying that condition, return one of them.
Please note that if you want to use a hash table, you can't use python's dictionary and you should implement your own.

Limitations:
Array size is not greater than 10^3
Array's elements are positive integers less than 10^12
An optimized algorithm can run in O(n^2)

option.name: possibleAnswer
descriptionText
option.value:
Prerequisite:
Read the hashing notebook.

Task:
The smallest period of a sequence is defined as the smallest positive (nonzero) integer T such that for every i < len(seq) - T we have
seq[i] = seq[i + T]
Complete smallest_period function such that for every string str, it returns the str's smallest period.

Input: seq (A string of lower case characters)
Output: str's smallest period

Limitations:
seq size is not greater than 10^6
You can solve this problem in linear time using hash

option.name: possibleAnswer
option.value: # p, q = 27, 10**9 + 7 # hash_list = hash(str, q, p) # offset = p # for T in range(1, len(str)): # if is_period(hash_list, T, offset, q): # return T # offset = (offset * p) % q return 0

option.name: possibleAnswer
option.value: def is_period(hash_list, T, offset, q): return (hash_list[len(hash_list) - T - 1] * offset) % q == (hash_list[len(hash_list) - 1] - hash_list[T - 1]) % q

option.name: possibleAnswer
option.value: def hash(str, q, p): hash_list = [ord(str[0]) - ord('a') + 1] s = 1 for i in range(1, len(str)): s = (s * p) % q hash_list.append((hash_list[i - 1] + (ord(str[i]) - ord('a') + 1) * s) % q) return hash_list

option.name: descriptionText
option.value:
Prerequisite:
Read the binary search notebook.

Complete the lower bound function.

** This is just a simple example of what you can do.
Try your best to come up with good ideas that help students learn better.

** Try out different approaches.

You can add hints (if needed) anywhere in task text. Copy all hint div block and change its content.
